body_html:
The results of my testing so far as as follows. All tests with Ubuntu 16.04.2 (kernel 4.4.0-72 or -78) and CUDA 8.0.61:

TF      Driver    cuDNN     Comment
1.0.1   361.119   5.0.10    OK
1.0.1   375.51    5.1.10    Hang/Assert
1.0.1   375.51    6.0.20    Hang/Assert
1.1.0   361.119   5.0.10    OK
1.1.0   375.51    6.0.20    Assert
1.1.0   375.66    6.0.20    Assert/Hang

The problem seems not to occur with the 361 series driver, but does with the 375 series driver.

Generally, I see much higher throughput (images / sec) with TF 1.1.0 and with the system more aggressively tuned (with adjustments to performance governor, SMT mode, and GPU clock settings).

  • In the lower-throughput configs the symptom is more likely a process hang.
  • In the higher-throughput configs the symptom is more likely the assert.

Will share these results with NVIDIA.

For now, I'd suggest using the 361-series driver, and would be interested in any reports of hangs or asserts with that driver.

body:
The results of my testing so far as as follows. All tests with Ubuntu 16.04.2 (kernel 4.4.0-72 or -78) and CUDA 8.0.61:

    TF      Driver    cuDNN     Comment
    1.0.1   361.119   5.0.10    OK
    1.0.1   375.51    5.1.10    Hang/Assert
    1.0.1   375.51    6.0.20    Hang/Assert
    1.1.0   361.119   5.0.10    OK
    1.1.0   375.51    6.0.20    Assert
    1.1.0   375.66    6.0.20    Assert/Hang

The problem seems not to occur with the 361 series driver, but does with the 375 series driver.

Generally, I see much higher throughput (images / sec) with TF 1.1.0 and with the system more aggressively tuned (with adjustments to performance governor, SMT mode, and GPU clock settings).

- In the lower-throughput configs the symptom is more likely a process hang.
- In the higher-throughput configs the symptom is more likely the assert.

Will share these results with NVIDIA.

For now, I'd suggest using the 361-series driver, and would be interested in any reports of hangs or asserts with that driver.
